„Äê

#‚Äã714 ‚Äî November 21, 2024

Read on the Web

ü¶É We're taking next week off for Thanksgiving. We don't celebrate it in our country, but we know many of you do, so it seemed a good time for a break. We'll be back on Thursday December¬†5.
__
Your editor, Peter Cooper

JavaScript Weekly

Importing a Frontend JavaScript Library Without a Build System ‚Äî Many developers prefer to eschew complex, modern build processes and use JavaScript in a more old-school way. You can definitely get by without a build system, and Julia explores some ways to import libraries in such a¬†setup.

Julia Evans

Angular v19 Released ‚Äî The latest version of the popular enterprise-scale app framework is here with a ‚ñ∂Ô∏è 22 minute introductory video running through what‚Äôs changed and what‚Äôs new, including incremental hydration (in preview), two new core reactivity primitives, event replay, and the ability to specify which routes are rendered server or client¬†side.

Minko Gechev

Ship Code Confidently When You Take Testing Fundamentals ‚Äî Join Steve Kinney for this video course on test-driven development workflows and nail the testing fundamentals. You'll learn about automation, equality, mocks and spies, integration testing, the tools to help you along the way, and much¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • üó≥Ô∏è The latest State of JS survey is now open and taking your responses. It's open until December¬†3.

  • üá´üá∑ dotJS 2025 is taking place next April in Paris,¬†France. If you'd like to speak, the CFP is open until November¬†29.

  • AWS Lambda, the serverless functions platform, turns ten years old this week. Its first runtime was¬†JavaScript-based.

  • Nova is an interesting new JavaScript engine that takes a CPU cache friendly data-oriented¬†approach.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.1.35 ‚Äì The fast JavaScriptCore-based runtime adds native support for Musl and Alpine Linux, the Bun binary is a lot smaller, console.group and groupEnd are now supported, and fs.readFile is faster on small¬†files.

  • Payload 3.0 ‚Äì Headless Next.js-native CMS¬†platform.

  • üìä Mantine v7.14.0 ‚Äì The popular React component suite adds new 'angle slider', radial bar chart, funnel chart, and stacking modal/drawer components.

  • Node.js v23.3.0 (Current) and v20.18.1 (LTS)

  • Ionic 8.4, ESLint v9.15.0, Turborepo 2.3, Deno 2.1, QuickJS 0.7

  • ü§û It wasn't released by the time we hit 'send' but we suspect TypeScript 5.7 will be out later today ‚Äì you can check on the TypeScript¬†blog.

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Exploring JavaScript Symbols ‚Äî Symbols were a new ‚Äòquirky little primitive‚Äô (as Trevor puts it) that arrived with ES6 ten years ago, but they continue to be poorly understood. Trevor boils them down really well, including a little side quest into the likely-to-be-deprecated ‚Äòspecies.‚Äô

Trevor I. Lasn

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future ‚Äî Next-level testing in any editor, 15x faster with Interactive Time Travel Debugger, real-time insights & advanced coverage in a new¬†UI.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Building Self-Contained Executable Programs with Deno ‚Äî One of Deno‚Äôs compelling features is its deno compile command that can turn JavaScript and TypeScript programs into single, easy to distribute cross-platform binaries. Here‚Äôs a bit more about what makes it¬†tick.

Ryan Dahl and Andy Jiang

Mapping Over Promises in JavaScript ‚Äî A quick look at three approaches: for..of, Promise.all, and p-map

Peter Mbanugo

Explore Sentry Launch Week: New Products and Community¬†Highlights ‚Äî Join us for daily video drops on YouTube at 9am PT, and on Discord to chat live with the engineers building¬†Sentry.

Sentry sponsor

üìÑ Migrating from VuePress to VitePress Henry Bley-Vroman

üìÑ Why Alpine is the 'New jQuery' and Why That's Awesome Raymond Camden

üìÑ How to Prerelease an npm Package Scott Vandehey

üìÑ Precise Decimal Math in JavaScript with Fraction.js Trevor I. Lasn

üìÑ How to Avoid Flaky Tests in Playwright Zanini and Ackerson

üìÑ Adding Interactive Charts in Astro Pavlin BG

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Viselect: Let Users Visually Select DOM Elements ‚Äî If you‚Äôve got a variety of elements and you want users to be able to select them in groups, individually, or even in multiple groups, this lets you offer that functionality easily. Can be used in a vanilla fashion or with integrations for P/React or¬†Vue.js.

Simon Reinisch

Perfectionist 4: ESLint Plugin for Sorting Things in Your¬†Code ‚Äî It doesn‚Äôt care what you want to sort (props, imports, types, decorators, modules..) but if you want to enforce something is sorted using ESLint, this is for you. It supports alphabetical and natural sorting, plus sorting by line length which results in this sort of¬†aesthetic.

Azat S.

Your Vectors Are Too Big ‚Äî Are your massive full-fidelity vectors slowing down your search? Compress, cut costs, and boost speed with MongoDB¬†Atlas!

MongoDB sponsor

React Scan: Detect Performance Issues in Your App ‚Äî A pure JavaScript tool you can drop into your app to automatically ‚Äòscan‚Äô for problematic renders without doing lots of integration work. There‚Äôs a simple demo on the homepage or you can see Aiden‚Äôs view of Twitter/X being scanned. GitHub¬†repo.

Aiden Bai

üí¨¬†Discordeno v19: A Powerful Discord API Library ‚Äî A long-standing way to work with, and build bots for, the popular Discord chat system. v19 is a big update with breaking changes. GitHub¬†repo.

Discordeno Team

ü§ñ¬†Vercel's AI Chatbot Starter Template ‚Äî An open source AI chatbot app template built using Next.js. It uses Vercel‚Äôs AI SDK and other Vercel APIs for the heavy¬†lifting.

Vercel

Glide.js 3.7: A Dependency-Free Slider and Carousel Control ‚Äî ‚ÄúDesigned to slide. No less, no more‚Äù says the creator. MIT licensed and¬†mature.

Jƒôdrzej Cha≈Çubek

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and¬†others.

Hookdeck: An alternative to Amazon API Gateway + Lambda + SQS. With local dev, debugging, and observability¬†built-in.

  • pretty-ms 9.2 ‚Äì Convert milliseconds to human readable strings. Now with options to hide years, seconds and days, as¬†preferred.

  • ‚òï Javet 4.1 ‚Äì Embed Node.js and V8 into¬†Java. Updates to Node v22.11.0 and adds Float16¬†support.

  • Embla Carousel 8.5 ‚Äì Lightweight carousel library with fluid motion.

  • Sortable 4.0 ‚Äì Make tables sortable with¬†class="sortable"

  • üìä Vue Data UI 2.4 ‚Äì Vue 3 data visualization¬†components.

  • Capacitor 6.2 ‚Äì Build cross-platform native apps with¬†JS.

  • Peggy 4.2 ‚Äì Parser generator for JavaScript.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã711 ‚Äî October 31, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Python Jumps to #1 on GitHub Over JavaScript, But... ‚Äî GitHub Universe took place this week, flooding us with data about how folks are using the platform. Of interest to those on social media was that Python has taken JavaScript's #1 language crown, though many argued that TypeScript (now #3) made an impact here. In positive news, JS still ranks first for code pushes alone and there's been a 15% jump in npm package consumption in the past¬†year.

GitHub

üéâ In other GitHub news, their Copilot AI coding tool can now use alternative LLMs like Gemini and Claude, and GitHub Spark is a new AI-powered tool for rapidly creating and deploying small apps.

Implementing Clean Architecture in Next.js ‚Äî Learn how to make projects testable and debuggable, independent of UI, framework, database, and external dependencies with the concept of Clean Architecture. Join us live on November¬†4th.

Sentry sponsor

Should JavaScript Be Split Into Two Languages? ‚Äî Two weeks ago we linked to an interesting slidedeck presented at TC39 where it was proposed to split JavaScript into two languages: a basic core and a fully featured version that needs tooling to compile it down. This covers a bit more of the story and led to a particularly extensive Hacker News discussion too.

Dev Class

ü§î You could argue TypeScript is already that second language..?

IN BRIEF:

  • ‚úÇÔ∏è The latest version of VS Code has a new experimental feature for updating imports when you copy and paste between JS/TS¬†files.

  • Lee Robinson and Delba de Oliveira present a quick recap of last week's Next.js Conf 2024 and its main¬†announcements.

  • ü§ñ Anthropic's Claude AI system has introduced an 'analysis' tool for writing and running JavaScript within a sandbox, so Claude can perform various calculations and analysis before returning answers.

  • üôã The Angular team is considering implementing a new Angular style guide to bring it up to 2024 standards and wants your input. The existing style guide was written in¬†2016.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v22.11.0 (LTS) - Codenamed Jod, this marks Node v22 becoming the active LTS release of Node, a status it will maintain until late¬†2025.

  • Node.js v23.1.0 (Current) ‚Äì The cutting edge Node release line makes JSON modules, import attributes, and the MockTimers test runner API stable.

  • üìä ApexCharts 4.0 ‚Äì Popular JS charting library updates its SVG.js¬†dependency.

  • Chakra UI v3 ‚Äì A full rewrite for the comprehensive React component¬†suite.

  • jQuery UI 1.14.1

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

How We Shrunk Our JavaScript Monorepo Git Size by 94% ‚Äî And by ‚Äúwe‚Äù, the author means Microsoft, which had an extremely large 178 gigabyte JavaScript monorepo on its hands ‚Äì big enough that many employees had problems cloning it at all. Jonathan tells the full story¬†here.

Jonathan Creamer

How to Roll Your Own Auth in JavaScript and TypeScript ‚Äî A snappy look at how to build a session-based authentication system, something Robin notes ‚Äúdoes not have to be¬†complicated‚Äù.

Robin Wieruch

MongoDB Atlas Search Integration with BuildShip ‚Äî MongoDB Atlas Search offers powerful full-text search, vector search, and hybrid search¬†capabilities.

MongoDB sponsor

Using shadcn/ui with React 19 (and Next.js 15) ‚Äî Fresh documentation from the shadcn/ui project on the specifics of using the popular component library with React 19 generally, though with a slight emphasis on Next.js¬†15.

shadcn

Reimplementing JavaScript's == in JavaScript ‚Äî What a trip. Whether or not you‚Äôre aware of the ‚Äòquirks‚Äô of JavaScript‚Äôs == operator, this could boggle your¬†mind.

Evan Hahn

HTML Form Validation is Heavily Underused ‚Äî An exploration of the ‚Äúpowerful validation mechanisms‚Äù of HTML forms, opining that they‚Äôre underused, and proposing why that lack of utilization may¬†be.

everdimension

üìÑ Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes ‚Äì If piping a Node app‚Äôs output to another command, mysterious problems can¬†arise.. Sam Lijin

üìÑ Introducing the New Svelte CLI Tool: sv Ben McCann

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Faker 9.1: Generate Fake, Realistic Data on Demand ‚Äî Names, bios, addresses, zip codes, dates, monetary amounts, transactions, and a lot more besides. I really like the guided DevTools console based demo you can try ‚Äì an idea other projects should consider. GitHub¬†repo.

Faker.js Team

Fraction.js: Library for Working with Rational Numbers ‚Äî The imprecise representation of floating point numbers can lead to all sorts of problems, so if you‚Äôre working with fractions at all, you might want a little more precision, which Fraction.js¬†offers.

Robert Eisele

Handsontable: Spreadsheet-Like JavaScript Data Grid for Your App ‚Äî Feature-rich data grid for developers seeking a powerful, customizable, and accessible solution to manage complex¬†data.

Handsontable sponsor

Fedify: A Framework for Building ActivityPub Servers ‚Äî If you want to join the fediverse with an app of your own (rather than leaning on Mastodon, say), this gives you the building blocks you¬†need.

Hong Minhee

Yantra: A JavaScript Engine for .NET Standard ‚Äî A managed JS engine for .NET Standard written in C# that supports both CommonJS and ES¬†modules.

Yantra Team

SVG.js: SVG Manipulation and Animation Library ‚Äî A lightweight approach without dependencies. There‚Äôs a demo on JSFiddle you can play with. GitHub¬†repo.

Various Authors

Dependency Cruiser 16.5: A Way to Visualize Dependencies ‚Äî If you want a look at the output, there‚Äôs a whole page of graphs for popular, real world projects including Chalk, Yarn, and¬†React.

Sander Verweij

AuthKit: The World‚Äôs Best Login Box ‚Äî Powered by WorkOS & Radix ‚Äî AuthKit is a complete solution for authentication, authorization, and user management. It‚Äôs free up to 1 million MAUs and comes standard with RBAC, bot protection, MFA, and¬†more.

AuthKit sponsor

üîä¬†WebAssembly Audio Decoders ‚Äî Targeting both browser and Node.js use cases, this is a collection of WASM-powered audio decoding libraries for formats like MPEG I/II/III, FLAC, Ogg Opus, Ogg FLAC, Opus, and Ogg¬†Vorbis.

Ethan Halsall

  • üì∫ YouTube.js 11.0 ‚Äì Unofficial JS client for YouTube's private¬†API.

  • Serverless Express 4.16 ‚Äì Run Express.js on AWS Lambda, API Gateway, Lambda@Edge, etc. Now supporting Express 5¬†too.

  • Execa 9.5 ‚Äì Powerful process execution library for Node. When redirecting stdout or stderr to a file, you can now optionally append rather than¬†replace.

  • MUI X 7.22 ‚Äì Popular React component¬†suite. Now with server-side support for Data Grid row¬†grouping.

  • üóìÔ∏è react-calendar 5.1 ‚Äì The 'ultimate' calendar for your React app.

  • üì∑ VisionCamera 4.6 ‚Äì Advanced camera control for React¬†Native.

  • Elliptic 6.6 ‚Äì Plain JS elliptic curve cryptography¬†implementation.

  • Acorn 8.14 ‚Äì Small, fast, JavaScript-based JavaScript¬†parser.

  • Strapi 5.2 ‚Äì Popular Node.js headless¬†CMS.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üè† Remote Senior Developer Experience Engineer - Passionate about React & GraphQL? Join us as a Developer Experience Engineer to elevate our dev community. Remote, EU¬†timezone.

How Google handles authorization at scale. A technical comparison of Google's Relationship-based authz system and Oso's Authz as a¬†Service.

item.title: „ÄêJSConf is back„ÄëJSConf ÂõûÊù•‰∫Ü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã712 ‚Äî November 7, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JavaScript's ??= Operator: Default Values Made Simple ‚Äî The ??= nullish coalescing assignment operator snuck into JavaScript a few years ago via ECMAScript 2021 and has been broadly supported almost everywhere for ages. Trevor shows off how it can tighten up your assignments¬†here.

Trevor I. Lasn

üí° He also took a similar look at the pipeline operator |>, but this feature is still only in draft as a¬†proposal.

üá∫üá∏¬†JSConf is Back; Here's the Details ‚Äî Two months ago, the OpenJS Foundation announced that the popular JSConf brand was joining the foundation and a new North American JSConf event would happen in due course. Now you can mark your calendars for October 14-16, 2025 for an event taking place in the Chesapeake Bay area of Maryland, USA.

OpenJS Foundation

Handsontable: A Powerful Data Grid for Internal¬†Apps ‚Äî Speed up the development of your React app with a feature-rich data grid - sorting, filtering, multiple cell types, built-in formulas, CRUD operations, and an extensive API. Come visit our booth at React Summit US on Nov 19th to see it in¬†action!

Handsontable sponsor

Announcing Rspack 1.1 ‚Äî Rspack is a fast, Rust-powered alternative to Webpack but with the same API. v1.1 boasts being 10% faster than v1.0 and has an improved, though still experimental, incremental build feature. If super fast build times are your bag, this needs to be on your¬†radar.

The Rspack Team

IN BRIEF:

  • üèÜ The OpenJS Foundation has honored six JavaScript developers with awards in categories including Unsung Hero and Pathfinder for¬†Education.

  • The working group behind the JSR package registry has met to outline plans for an open governance model and a roadmap to enhance JS package¬†management.

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Phylum takes a look at yet another (ongoing) typosquatting campaign to try and trick JavaScript developers into installing malicious packages.

  • There's fewer than two weeks left to take the State of React 2024 survey.

  • Storybook offers a sneak peek at their Storybook Test tool for fast UI¬†testing.

RELEASES:

  • VitePress 1.5 ‚Äì Evan You's Vite and Vue-powered static site generator.

  • create-vue 3.12 ‚Äì The recommended way to start a Vite-powered Vue project. Now with an experimental Oxlint¬†integration.

  • ESLint v9.14.0 ‚Äì Now supporting import attributes and regexp¬†modifiers.

  • Mermaid 11.4 ‚Äì The popular diagram / charting tool adds Kanban¬†diagrams.

  • React Navigation 7, Electron 33.1, TinyMCE 7.5.0, Bun v1.1.34

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Wasmer Adds Node.js and Bun Support ‚Äî Wasmer is a Rust-powered WebAssembly runtime and Wasmer 5.0 adds V8 and JavaScriptCore backend support, meaning you can try all sorts of things like, say, running Clang, Python, or even compiled JavaScript apps inside your own JavaScript app..

Syrus Akbary

Why Would Anyone Need Generator Functions? ‚Äî A golden oldie that I enjoyed revisiting because it covers an oft misunderstood and not particularly commonly encountered JavaScript¬†feature.

James Sinclair

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the¬†Future ‚Äî Next-level testing in any editor, 15x faster with Interactive Time Travel Debugger, real-time insights & advanced coverage in a new¬†UI.

Wallaby Team sponsor

The Most Effective Ways to Improve Core Web Vitals ‚Äî Everyone wants their site to be as performant as possible, especially when Google factors performance into its rankings, but how? Google shares a variety of practical techniques to improve your INP, LCP, and CLS metrics¬†here.

Google

Why Code Security Matters - Even in Hardened Environments ‚Äî A well diagrammed dive into a technique that allows malicious parties to turn a file write vulnerability in a Node.js app into a remote code execution exploit even when the file system is¬†read-only.

Stefan Schiller (Sonar)

Generating Random Mazes with JavaScript ‚Äî A fun, well-presented walkthrough of a basic maze generation¬†process.

Paul Hebert

Along similarly fun lines is Chris MMO's Generating Lever-Door¬†Puzzles.

MongoDB Helps Devs Build Better AI Agents with LangChain & Hybrid¬†Search ‚Äî It‚Äôs easier than ever to build AI agents with LangChain, perform hybrid search and ingest large-scale¬†documents.

MongoDB sponsor

üöó Hacking Cars in JavaScript ‚Äì Or ‚ÄúRunning Replay Attacks in the Browser with the¬†HackRF.‚Äù Charlie Gerard

üìÑ How Bun Supports V8 APIs Without Using V8 (Part 2) Ben Grant (Bun)

üìÑ How to Create an Organic Text Distortion Effect with Infinite Scrolling ‚Äì There's a live demo of the striking, though disorienting, effect. Jorge Toloza

üìÑ Vercel Makes Changes to Next.js to Simplify Self-Hosting Loraine Lawson (The New Stack)

üìÑ The Latest in Angular Change Detection ‚Äì All You Need to Know Krzysztof Skorupka

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

npmpackage.info: Detailed Package Info on a Single Page ‚Äî Give this online tool the name of an npm package and you get a quick ‚Äòdashboard‚Äô style view of the project‚Äôs main statistics, covering areas like quality scores, commits, open issues, releases, bundle size, and¬†more.

Shrinath Nayak

üìä NPM Chart is another cool new site focused on showing npm package download¬†stats.

Prompt, Run, Edit, and Deploy Full-Stack Web Apps with bolt.new ‚Äî StackBlitz recently released an in-browser AI web development agent: bolt.new! Give it a try¬†today.

StackBlitz sponsor

Docusaurus 3.6: The Docs-Oriented Static Site Generator ‚Äî Meta‚Äôs Docusaurus is a popular way to build docs sites (like these). v3.6 is focused on performance, now using tools like Rspack and SWC to make builds super¬†fast.

Meta

Immutable.js 5.0: Immutable Collections for JavaScript ‚Äî Provides numerous persistent immutable data structures including a list, stack, map, ordered map, set, ordered set, and¬†records.

Lee Byron and Contributors

Sonner 1.7: The Toast Notification React Component ‚Äî There‚Äôs a live demo to try on the homepage, or see the GitHub repo. v1.7 focuses on animation improvements, browser support, and React¬†19.

Emil Kowalski

Quaternion.js: A JavaScript Quaternion library ‚Äî Last week we featured the author‚Äôs Fraction.js library, now we go a step deeper with a way to work with 3D rotations using quarternions.

Robert Eisele

  • BlockNote 0.19 ‚Äì 'Notion-style' block-based¬†editor. Now supporting column-based layouts and client-side export to .docx and¬†PDF. There's a demo on the project's¬†homepage.

  • üîê OpenPGP.js 6.0 ‚Äì OpenPGP implementation for JavaScript now supporting the new version of the OpenPGP spec, RFC 9580.

  • Fastify 5.1 ‚Äì The fast, low overhead Node.js web¬†framework.

  • xr 6.4 ‚Äì Bring VR/AR to React Three¬†Fiber¬†apps.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

‚öôÔ∏è Create entire web apps with Reactile and let it handle your widgets and windows within a single browser tab. 1-month free trial. Try it now.

Meticulous automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and others.

Pythagora is an AI dev tool that builds production-ready tools (not demo apps). It writes the code and talks to you in the process.

üìó¬†We're also reading..

We've also had some tabs open that aren't JavaScript specific but you might find interesting nonetheless:

ü´£ Weird Lexical Syntax by Justine Tunney. Justine is building a syntax highlighter and set out to learn 42 programming languages in a single month to help figure out the edge cases. She recounts the surprising things she discovered about the syntax of various languages, including¬†JavaScript.

üëª Before You Buy a Domain, Check if it's Haunted by Bryan Braun. Buying a domain for a side project is always fun, but it's far less fun when the domain was previously used for nefarious purposes and comes with¬†baggage..

ü§î What Has Case Distinction But is Neither Uppercase or Lowercase? by Raymond Chen. It sounds like a riddle, but there are actually Unicode characters that have case distinction yet are neither uppercase nor lowercase¬†themselves.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã713 ‚Äî November 14, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Component Party: A Rosetta Stone of UI Libraries ‚Äî A long-standing comparison of many different frameworks (like React, Vue, Svelte, Angular, Qwik, Solid.js, etc.) by way of simple code snippets to perform various tasks. Now including Svelte¬†5 and Angular¬†17/Renaissance.

Mathieu Schimmerling

Will We Care About Frameworks in the Future? ‚Äî Paul wonders if the increasing use of LLMs and agents in software development will lead to a reduction in the need for new frameworks and extra developer-focused¬†abstractions.

Paul Kinlan

Advanced JavaScript Tools to Empower Your Applications ‚Äî Build better web applications with powerful JavaScript developer tools including: SpreadJS Excel-like spreadsheet components, ActiveReportsJS reporting tools, Wijmo UI component suite, and Document Solutions viewers for PDF, Excel, Image, and¬†more.

MESCIUS inc sponsor

The vlt Package Manager and Serverless Registry ‚Äî A very experienced team, including npm creator Isaac Schlueter, launched Vlt to ‚Äòbuild the future‚Äô of JavaScript package management. The first results have appeared in the shape of the vlt client (which can replace npm), as well as a serverless package registry you can self host to serve up your own¬†packages.

Clarke, Adorno, Schlueter, and Karrys

üí° Sarah Gooding shares some more background on Vlt's story¬†here.

TypeScript 5.7 Release Candidate ‚Äî The popular typed JS superset adds support for ES2024 as a target, can report errors when variables aren't initialized, adds path rewriting for relative paths, and can use Node‚Äôs compile caching to save on parsing work. The final release is expected in a week or¬†two.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • ü§ñ Microsoft has introduced Copilot Edits in VS Code ‚Äì it provides a way to work across multiple files in a project at once.

  • Jawsm is an early-stage, experimental JavaScript to WebAssembly compiler (akin to Porffor) but that aims to use the most advanced WASM features off the bat, such as WasmGC and exception handling.

  • üíú CSS now has an official logo!

RELEASES:

  • Expo SDK 52 ‚Äì Toolset for building modern React Native apps, now supporting React Native 0.76 and the New¬†Architecture.

  • Node.js v18.20.5 (LTS) ‚Äì Lots of dependency updates and now import attributes and JSON modules are marked¬†stable.

  • No announcement, but it looks like Ember 6.0 is about to land.

  • Node.js v23.2.0 (Current), pnpm 9.13, Parcel 2.13.0

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

JavaScript Import Attributes (ES2025) Explained ‚Äî Import Attributes (now at stage 4 at TC39 and already supported in some runtimes) add a way to supply useful metadata about modules you‚Äôre¬†importing.

Trevor I. Lasn

üí° Trevor is on quite a run of great posts. He also digs into Promise.try and how JavaScript's bitwise shifting operators¬†work.

Creating an ASCII Shader Using OGL ‚Äî An incredibly cool effect demonstrated in a great tutorial on getting started with shaders and using OGL, a lightweight WebGL¬†library.

Andrico Karoulla

Guide to Error & Exception Handling in React ‚Äî Learn common errors and best practices for recovering from them in a user-friendly¬†way.

Sentry sponsor

How a BBC Navigation Bar Component Broke Depending on Which External Monitor It Was On ‚Äî A look at an interesting bug related to external monitor positioning. The lesson is that ‚Äúbrowsers have an interoperability issue in how they represent screen coordinates in multi-monitor¬†setups‚Äù.

Josh Tumath

How to Set Up Next.js 15 for Production in 2024 ‚Äî Share in this author‚Äôs experience in scaling up Next.js apps to over 100k monthly active users and millions of monthly¬†visitors.

Jan Hesters (ReactSquad)

‚ñ∂¬†¬†From Next.js to htmx: A Real World Example ‚Äî An interesting case study explained in a 50-minute screencast: ‚ÄúReplacing my components with the equivalent HTML elements powered by htmx wasn‚Äôt exactly an easy task, but one that was worth the¬†time.‚Äù

Pouria Ezzati

üìÑ How to Optimize Performance in Vue Apps Jakub Andrzejewski

üìÑ How to Build a Database App with Drizzle ORM and Deno Andy Jiang

üìÑ Essential tsconfig.json Options You Should Use Duy NG

üì∫ Building a Rich Text Editor with Svelte 5 Michael Aufreiter

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Lexical 0.20: An Easy-to-Extend Text Editor Framework from Meta ‚Äî A text editor framework built by Meta with extensibility, accessibility, and cross platform support in mind (there‚Äôs even a Swift variant for iOS). There‚Äôs a live playground if you want to give it a try. React support is first class, but it can be adapted to work elsewhere (as with svelte-lexical).

Meta / Facebook

Introducing @clerk/nextjs v6, with Support for Next.js 15 ‚Äî With v6, auth() helper is async, <ClerkProvider> defaults to static rendering, and partial pre-rendering is¬†supported.

Clerk sponsor

Storybook 8.4 Released ‚Äî A minor release for the powerful frontend component workshop but ‚Äúone of our most feature-packed minor releases‚Äù with one click component testing, Svelte 5 support, and React Native Storybook 8.

Michael Shilman

üóìÔ∏è¬†Schedule-X 2.5: Material Design Calendar and Date Picker ‚Äî Available in the form of React/Preact, Vue, Svelte, Angular, or plain JS components. Open source but with a premium version with extra features. GitHub¬†repo.

Tom √ñsterlund

üéµ¬†music-metadata: Stream and File-Based Music Metadata Parser ‚Äî Supporting formats like MP3, FLAC, Ogg, WAV, WMA, AAC and AIFF, this library extracts metadata like ID3v1 and iTunes tags for processing however you want. Yes, it even works in the¬†browser.

Borewit

Looking for a DIY Survey Solution? SurveyJS Has You Covered ‚Äî Build, customize, and store surveys with ease. Total data control, JSON-driven, no backend restrictions‚Äîintegrates into any JavaScript¬†app.

SurveyJS sponsor

Micromark 4.0.1: A Small Compliant Markdown Parser ‚Äî 100% compliance with the CommonMark standard, supports extensions (such as for GitHub Flavored Markdown), and full test¬†coverage.

Titus Wormer

jsep 1.4: JavaScript Expression Parser ‚Äî ‚ÄúThink of jsep as a tool to parse the kinds of expressions that would be written in individual Excel¬†cells.‚Äù

Stephen Oney

  • üìä visx 3.12 ‚Äì Airbnb's suite of React visualization components now includes a Sankey diagram¬†component.

  • üñºÔ∏è Fabric.js 6.5 ‚Äì Makes HTML5 Canvas elements more interactive with an object model and operations. GitHub¬†repo.

  • DOMPurify 3.2 ‚Äì Fast, tolerant XSS sanitizer for HTML and¬†SVG. Demo.

  • MikroORM 6.4 ‚Äì Popular TypeScript¬†ORM for¬†Node.js.

  • Marked 15.0 ‚Äì Fast Markdown compiler¬†/¬†parser.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üéπ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trial¬†available.

Never miss a Shopify, Stripe, GitHub, Paddle‚Ä¶ or any webhook again with Hookdeck's serverless queue infrastructure. Learn¬†more.

Meticulous automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and¬†others.

üòÄ¬†More fun at Val Town

I've written about Val Town several times and am a huge fan. It's a site where you can write and deploy TypeScript from your browser and describes itself as "if GitHub Gists could run, and AWS Lambda was fun."

It's been a delight to watch its progression from a prototype to what is now a solid platform used in production use cases and I want to call out some recent posts that keep it on my radar:

Building a Code-Writing Robot and Keeping it Happy ‚Äì Townie is an AI assistant for building apps on Val Town. This post digs into how it works, some of the problems encountered in its creation, and how its results are¬†evaluated.

Val Town Town ‚Äì Could you implement something like Val Town on Val Town itself? At the risk of eating its own tail, it turns out you can.

If you're stuck for something to do or check out, check out Val Town ‚Äì it's¬†fun!
